Package com.facebook.buck.rules.coercer

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    TypeCoercer<T>
    Class defining an interpretation of some dynamically typed Java object as a specific class.
    TypeCoercer.Traversal  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AppleSource
    Simple type representing an iOS or OS X source entry, which can be either: A SourcePath, or A SourcePath plus compiler flags, or A "source group" (a group name and one or more AppleSource objects)
    AppleSourceTypeCoercer
    A type coercer to handle source entries in an iOS or OS X rule.
    BuildRuleTypeCoercer  
    BuildTargetTypeCoercer  
    CollectionTypeCoercer<C extends ImmutableCollection<T>,T>  
    Either<LEFT,RIGHT>
    A simple discriminated union of two parameters.
    EitherTypeCoercer<Left,Right>
    Coerces a type to either type, trying the left type before the right.
    EnumTypeCoercer<E extends Enum<E>>  
    IdentityTypeCoercer<T>  
    LabelTypeCoercer  
    LeafTypeCoercer<T>
    Superclass of coercers for non-collection/map types.
    ListTypeCoercer<T>  
    MapTypeCoercer<K,V>  
    NumberTypeCoercer<T extends Number>
    Coerces numbers with rounding/truncation/extension.
    Pair<FIRST,SECOND>
    Simple type representing a pair of differently typed values.
    PairTypeCoercer<FIRST,SECOND>
    Coerces from a 2-element collection into a pair.
    PathTypeCoercer  
    SetTypeCoercer<T>  
    SortedSetTypeCoercer<T extends Comparable<T>>  
    SourcePathTypeCoercer  
    TypeCoercerFactory
    Create TypeCoercers that can convert incoming java structures (from json) into particular types.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AppleSource.Type
    The type of source entry this object represents.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CoerceFailedException
